ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:52): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: would it be an idea for the websocket protocol spec to have it's version incremented to draft77, as to avoid any confusion between 76 (which is in chrome 5), and > 76
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): it's version is r5190
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:53): or would it be possible to introduce a Sec-WebSocket-Version, which indicates what version of the protocol is supported?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): 76 is out of date
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): loooong out of date
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:53): as there's no other way to detect
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): there's only one version
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): nothing to detect
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:54): but there are various versions in various browsers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:54): (s/it's/its/)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:54): (yikes)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:54): well, sure
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:54): but they'll go away
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:54): eg 75 in Safari 5 and 76 in latest chrome
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:54): doesn't help anyone if i add Sec-WebSocket-Version today for that problem
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): and you can easily distinguish the two if you really want to support safari 5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): just look at what headers it has
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:55): well, we can already switch 75 and 76 based on the Sec-* headers
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:55): but for > 76 like, r5190, we can't do that.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): *shrug*
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:55): and as r5190 isn't yet implemented by a client, it would be possible to add a Sec-WebSocket-Version
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): the idea is for there to be a single version
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:56): true, but browsers are never ideal
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): adding features just to be able to distinguish test versions for the few months before we're done is pointless
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): it would mean bytes being included in requests for decades after it's useful
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:57): Do you expect to be completely done in a few months?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:57): the best thing to do if you want to solve the problem is to implement the updated protocol in all the browsers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:57): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: we're more or less done now, as far as i can tell
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:57): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I'd be way out of my depth there.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:57): k, good to know.
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (01:57): considering I'm a JavaScript programmer, not a C / C++ programmer
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:59): that's solvable :-)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: for documenting pros and cons of websocket proposals
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:59): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: if he needs a wiki, he's welcome to use the websocket one
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: but i believe the hybi wg have their own

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:03): about?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:03): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: uh, don't you think you got r5190 backwards?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (02:03): ^ http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html-templates/outliner.php?url=http://html5doctor.com
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:03): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: surely we don't want the controls to appear on the top when there are captions
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:03): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: instead the captions should move so they don't appear behind the controls
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:04): hm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:04): the captions can be positioned precisely
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:04): i suppose we could make the captions avoid the controls when they're line-snapped controls
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:05): the captions get moved if there are already captions where you want to position them precisely, don't they?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:05): yeah, true
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:07): i think i'd just move the captions up while the controls are visible, as if the root box had margin-top: -(height-of-controls)
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:28): hmm, I guess I need to look at how websocket protocol has changed (again)
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:30): looks pretty same to v76
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:30): at least as ugly as v76
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:31): yeah only minor changes
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:32): ah, the API has changed too
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:32): there is now protocols[]
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:32): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:33): i mailed wellington about it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:33): wasn't sure who else to mail
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:33): I wonder what the use case is for that.
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:34): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: well, if you could cc me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:35): the protocols[] thing was mentioned on the hybi list

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:36): basically the use case was to let someone who implements several protocols in the JS but doesn't know what the server implements simply give the list to the server
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:36): and let the server pick
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:37): not sure that is a good use case
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:37): yeah i wasn't hugely convinced either, but it seemed easy enough to support.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:39): i recommend posting on the hybi thread if you want the protocol changed... i think it was http://www.ietf.org/mail-archive/web/hybi/current/msg02250.html
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (02:42): oh, it was somewhere in that thread
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:46): (i didn't see anyone say it was a bad idea, which is why i went with it)
